title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh, hello there, kids! Welcome to Lolly's Candy Shop.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We're the kids whose names you called on your commercial last night. We're here to do the shopping spree!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh that's great!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You bet your fat clown ass it is!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Okay! Well I'll just need your ticket stub.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: ...ticket stub?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Well you know. When you entered the contest you got the other half of this ticket.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh shit. Who had the ticket stub??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: It was such a long time ago!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Wu-we don't "really" need the ticket stub, do we?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Don't need the ticket stub?? Are you high?? How else do I know you're the winners?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Because our names were called on the commercial last night!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Sh-orry boys. No ticket stub, no candy shopping spree. If you find it, you can come back, but you only have one week to claim the prize. That's called "The Ticking Clock." Works great in the movies.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: GODDAMNIT!!!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We're gotta find that ticket!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Which one of us took it?! It was so long ago, I c- I can't remember.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You guys we've got to focus! We've got to focus, and remember.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Lolly's Candy Factory, over a year ago. Kenny is still alive back then.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: All right. There you go. Hold on to that ticket stub. You'll need it to claim your prize.  Shign up for the five-minute shopping spree!!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You hold on to this, Cartman. I might lose it.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Nah, I'll lose it for sure. You keep track of it, Kyle.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Okay.  N-no, ah I don't want that much responsibility. Here, you hold on to it, Kenny.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: (Okay.)

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: back to the present. The boys realize Kenny was the last to hold the stub as their mouths open.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny!!!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: AAAHHH!!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny's house, later. The boys arrive gasping for air and Kyle rings the doorbell.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yes?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Where's Kenny??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Uh... boys... Kenny died ...last December. Don't you remember?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We know he's dead. We mean, where is his body??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: His body? Well, why??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Because he has the God-damned ticket for the-!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Uh, look. We just really miss our friend and, ah, andand we need to see his remains for closure.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yeah. Closure.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What the fuck is closure?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh all right boys. Come on in.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny's house, inside. The boys follow the parents through the house

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We haven't seen you boys for so long, we thought you'd forgotten all about him.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Here he is, boys. Our dear little Kenny.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You turned him into a teapot?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: No. That's an urn, boys. Kenny's inside it.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Your friends are here to see you, Kenny. They miss you an awful lot, like we all do.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Thang-thanks for coming by, boys. Ih-ih, it means a lot to us.  Aw now, honey.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny's house, nighttime, living room. A circle appears on a window and that piece of window is removed. Cartman sets the circle down and looks around. He reaches up to open the window latch, then opens the window door. He slips in and goes for the urn. He pulls out a fake detector and moves it around

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Wewewewewewe...

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Did you get it?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Hold on, I'm checking for robot guards. Wewewewewewe...

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: There's not gonna be any robot guards, retard! Just get Kenny!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Wewewewewewe...

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Cartman's house, night, kitchen. The boys rush to the counter and climb up on the stools

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Alright, we made it!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny'd better have the ticket stub with him in there!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Let him out, Cartman!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: ...Kenny?  Kenny?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Is he in there?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I can't see.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What the hell is this?! Chocolate milk mix?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I knew Kenny couldn't fit in that tea pot!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: It wa a trick!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: God-damnit! This isn't even GOOD chocolate milk mix!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny's parents must be laughing pretty hard about now! We're dumb enough to believe Kenny's body could be in a teapot!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Why would they play such a cruel joke on us?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Egh, because they're poor, Kyle! Poor people don't have anything better to do than piss other people off! Don't you watch Springer?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We just have to face it. We're not gonna get Kenny back and we're not goona have our shopping spree. It's over!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: God-damnit! There has to be a way!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Hmmm.  Hmm, not bad.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Cartman's room, night. The empty glass sits on his nightstand. The camera zooms out to show Cartman sleeping with Clyde Frog. Cartman tosses in his bed and his dream appears. A circle appears. Outisde of the circle is a lining to a jacket. Inside is someone's point of view. The surroundings seen in that circle indicates that this is Kenny's point of view. Kenny seems to be walking around in his own room. Kenny's arm appears and opens the door, and Kenny's mom appears at the end of the hall.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Hurry up, Kenny! You're gonna be late for school!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Huh! ... I don't think that chocolate milk mix agreed with my stomach.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Cartman, come on!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What what?  Jesus, you buttholes! It's six in the morning!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kyle figured out a way to get our winning ticket stub back from Kenny!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: How?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: A ladder to heaven.  We build it, climb up, and get our winning ticket back from that asshole Kenny.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Stan's house, day. The blueprints are in place on an easel. The design is a slender tower rising some 120 feet into the sky. The camera pulls back to show the boys hammering boards into place. Stan's parents step outside to see the construction.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Hey, if you boys are building a clubhouse you should start with the floor.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We're not building a clubhouse, we're building a ladder to heaven.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: A ladder to heaven? Why, son?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Because we wanna see Kenny again.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh... oh, that's so sweet.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: That's the ...s-s-saddest thing I've ever heard.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Hey Randy, can I borrow your uh... What the hell are they doing?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: The boys wanna see their dead friend Kenny again, Jimbo, so they're... building a ladder to heaven.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Awwww.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kyle, I think you've bothered the Marshes enough.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: No, it's... alright, Sheila. The boys were just... building a ladder to heaven to see their old friend, Kenny.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: A ladder tuh... Oh... oh God.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh, that's so touching.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Behind Stan's house, day. A reporter has arrived and now begins his report

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Tom, I'm standing in South Park, Colorado, where last December, eight-year-old Kenny McCormick died of a terminal illness. But now, that little boy's three closest friends miss their friend so much that they are building a ladder to heaven, in order to-  a ladder to heaven in order to try to see him again.  It's so sad and yet so beautiful, Tom. Here's what some people had to say.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Well, our son just said to us that he really needed to see his little friend Kenny again and... and that he thought it would work...  if he... built the ladder to heaven.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: They just believe in their little hearts that it will work. We can't tell them it won't, we just can't!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: It shows how beautiful the innocence of a child really is.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: A ladder to heaven? That's fuckin' stupid.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: These boys symbolize how we all feel about loss. Who are we to tell them it's impossible?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Tom, people from all over the-  Sorry. People from all over the country are coming to see the ladder, feeling a connection to its symbolism, and beauty. Even country singer Alan Jackson has shown up with a song he has written about the ladder.  Alan Jackson is, of course, the man who wrote the song, "Where Were You When the World Stopped Turning," about the tragedies on September 11. And now he's here once again to capitalize on people's emotions. Let's listen in.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Where were you when they built the ladder to heaven?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
role: Did it make you feel like cryin', or did you think it was kind
text: of gay?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What a beautiful song.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Well I, for one, believe in the ladder to heaven.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
role: Oh yeah yeah yeah. 9-11 [the townsfolk begin to cry]

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
role: Thank you! I have a new CD out with all my 9-11 songs for sale
text: right here! [the crowd rushes in to get copies of the CD. Jackson is pleased at the interest. The boys resume their construction. Stan and Kyle are hammering away at the top of the ladder. Cartman hustles up the ladder with a car seat]

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh good! Cartman's back from the junkyard.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I found this car seat in Mr. Garrison's car.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Mr. Garrison threw away his car?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: ...No.  Ey! Euuugh.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Flashback #2 - resumes where the first one left off. Kenny seems to be walking around in his own room. Kenny's arm appears and opens the door, and Kenny's mom appears at the end of the hall.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Hurry up, Kenny! You're gonna be late for school!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny, do you by any chance know what happened to my Playboys?  Kenny?! Answer me!!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Cartman? Cartman?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Wha-uh, what?? What?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Dude, what the hell's wrong with you?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I don't know. It's like my brain just keeps... jacking off.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Maybe you got brain cancer.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Do you think?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Don't get cancer on the ladder, Cartman! You're gonna fall off and break it!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: SNN newscast. Graphics are shown indicating 74% of Americans believe in the ladder

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: The nation is rallying behind three sweet boys in Colorado who are building a ladder to heaven to be with their dead friend.  It's making Americans start to believe in heaven, again.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Well when I see how this ladder has brought people together, how... how it has changed America, I mean, how can I not believe?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Ha do YOU actually believe in the ladder to heaven?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: If... heaven is an eight-year-old boy, and the ladder is my penis...  and the pearly gates are the-

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Uh, meanwhile, the American economy cont-  wait. Wait. Wait a minute. We are getting reports now that Ja-pan is building their own ladder to heaven to compete with the US's's. Let's go live to SNN correspondent Nobuhiro Sabasurisurijuwa.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: This is a Nobunaga Hiroichi reporting rive from Tokyo, where Japan has started buirding its own radder to hayben. Ahready, the Japanese radder extend faaar into space  and it's growing by a-one thousand miles every day.  As the endeavor continues it is becoing clear that Japan will reach a-hayben before the United States.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: South Park, just past sunset. The neighbors have gathered around the ladder in Stan's back yard and are now singing

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Nahurabo Nahurabo

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Excuse me.  Excuse me!  Uh, we ran out of stuff.  We ran out of stuff to build theh ladder with.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh no!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh Jesus, no!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Where were you when they ran out of stuff to build the ladder to heaven?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We can keep going, but we need to start tearing down houses for wood.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: No! Agh, look, I, I think maybe this has gone on far enough.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yeah... Ih it's time we told the boys the truth, that they aren't really going to get to heaven.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Wait! Look!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We've come to help you beat those Japs, boys!  There won't be anyone stopping this great ladder from being built today! Alpha Team! Get that support structure up! Ciranom's Team! Get us photos and recon!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yes sir!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Where were you when they saved that ladder to heaven?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Man, I can't believe how much people want us to get our winning ticket back.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Candy-shopping sprees have that effect on people, Kyle.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: South Park, next day. The boys resume building the ladder, and they almost break through the cloud above them. Stan is the first to peer over the clouds. Kyle soon joins him.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Do you see anything?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: No. Hello?? Kenny?? God??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Grandma??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Aw, don't tell me we haven't even reached the cloud city yet!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: No cloud city, not even a giant. Heaven must still be a long way off.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Alright, look. I didn't wanna have to say this, but I think maybe we're not seeing heaven because one of us doesn't believe in it enough.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Huh?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Heaven could be like the pixie faeries of Bubble Yum Forest. You only see them if you really believe in them.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You know, maybe we're not seeing heaven because one of us is a J-O-O.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What does me being a Jew have to do with anything?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Because Jews don't believe in heaven!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yes we do! Just not the Christian heaven!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Right. Your idea of heaven is getting five dollars off your matzah ball soup at Barney's Beanery by lying about a hair in it.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: HAAHH!!!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: AH!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Flashback #2 - Kenny arrives at the bus stop.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Hey Kenny.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Hey Kenny.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: (Hey you guys. What's goin' on, man?)

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: In the ghetto, in the ghetto. He was born where hungry children cry, kickin', his whole family resides in the ghetto, in the ghetto

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: (Shut up, Cartman, you blood-belching vagina!)

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What did you say?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: (I said, Shut up, Cartman, you blood-belching vagina!)

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What did you say?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I said "Shut up, Cartman, you blood-belching vagina!"  Did I just call myself a blood-belching vagina?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Dude, what the hell is wrong with you??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I dunno, I just, I keep feeling like I'm Kenny. Seeing memories through his eyes.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You're too fat to be Kenny.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You're a- stupid Jew.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Let's just keep building. We only have five more days until the shopping spree.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: The White House, Washington D.C., moments later. George Bush arrives at the Oval Office and takes his seat at the executive desk

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Alright, how's the ladder going, General? Are we beating the Japanese.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Not quite, but we have a new problem, Mr. President. Our recon team on the ladder just found new evidence of threats... from Saddam Hussein.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Saddam Hussein? But... we killed him! We secretly took him out months ago!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yes sir. And now we believe he's building weapons of mass destruction... in heaven.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Dear Christ, that sonofabitch just doesn't stop!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: These surveillance photos were taken atop the ladder of what appears to be heaven.  Here we see what we believe to be a missile silo. And here  we see what looks like a laboratory of some sort for making chemical weapons.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: That... kinda looks like a seagull.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yes. It could be a laboratory disguised as a seagull.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: That tricky bastard!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Sir, you must understand our fears. We must take out those facilities. We must...  bomb heaven!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: SNN newsroom, new poll

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: SNN Question of the Day: Now that Americans believe in heaven, should we bomb it? The polls right now show that 51% of Americans think Saddam has to be dealt with, while 49% are wimpy tree-hugging pussies.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: War is not my voice! This country is just run by rednecks and bumpkins with their guns!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We have to take Saddam out to protect ourselves.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I, for one, believe that if Saddam Hussein were an eight-year-old boy, and my penis were the United States...  then there would-  hard nipples!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: God-damnit!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: News 4 field report

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Tom, it's been five days since three sweet boys set out to build a ladder to heaven and caption the nation's hearts. They've made a nation believe heaven might be up there. And it could prove to be a threat to our country. President Bush will seek UN approval for military action.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: The Marsh home, day. The boys' ladder is seen rising above the house, in the backyard. In the dining room, the boys' parents sit opposite the boys at the table.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Boys, it's really neat that you want to see your old pal Kenny so much but...

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: But it's time for you to get back to school and on with your lives.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: No, we have to see Kenny!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You have to understand that Kenny's body isn't up in the clouds. He was cremated.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Cremated? What's that?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: When you die, your body is put into a broiling oven and cooked until you're nothing but ashes.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What?? For God's sake, why??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kyle, it's just what some people do.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Are you gonna burn me?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kyle, that's not the issue right now.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Jesus Christ!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: The person's ashes are put into an urn, and that's where Kenny's body is.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You see boys, Kenny is in here.  What the???  Wait a minute! This is kitty litter!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Alright, alright, I drank the chocolate milk mix and replaced it with kitty litter.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You WHAT??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Dude, don't you know what this means? You drank Kenny!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Shut up!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You did, dude! You drank his whole body!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Shut up!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh my God! This is awful!  And disgusting!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Bad, Eric, bad!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: That explains it. Why I'm having Kenny's memories all the time. His soul is inside me.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Well, so much for our winning ticket. Cartman probably drank that with the rest of Kenny!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yeah. Good job, fatass!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I can't live like this. I, I have to find a place where they remove living souls from your body.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Day, Unplanned Parenthood, a place where they remove living souls from a pregnant woman's body, if you believe fetuses have souls... Cartman speaks to the nurse, who is sitting behind a desk writing absentmindedly

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Looks like I've come to the right place.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Can I help you?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yes, hello. I have a living thing inside of me that needs to be sucked out, please.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You'll have to make an appointment; the charge is two hundred and thirty dollars.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Two hundred and thirty dollars?? I just want you to vacuum him out of me and not put him up in a condominium!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: It's gonna be okay, babe.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Listen, lady! You've got to get this crap out of me!  I don't want him in me anymore! Just suck him up and throw him out!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh Steven, I can't go through with this! I have to keep it!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Damnit! Damnit!  Thanks a lot, kid!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Ey!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: The scene is the sidewalk. Stan, Cartman and Kyle run up to Kenny

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny! Kenny!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny! Lolly's Candy Land is giving away a shopping spree!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: We're all gonna pitch in on an entry!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: There you go. Hold on to that ticket stub.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You hold on to this, Cartman. I might lose it.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Nah, I'll lose it for sure. You keep track of it, Kyle.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Okay.  N-no, ah I don't want that much responsibility. Here, you hold on to it, Kenny.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: (Okay.)

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You'd better not lose that ticket, Kenny, or else I'll kick you in the nuts! The nuts! The nuts!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Back to the present. Cartman comes to and knows where to go

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: The ticket! Kenny didn't have it on him when he died! He put it away somewhere! Don't you see? I can still have my candy shopping spree! Oh my God!  You guys! YOU GUYS!!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: The United Nations, day. In the main hall President Bush is speaking to the Assembly

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Ladies and gentlemen of the UN, we have evidence that Saddam Hussein is up there building weapons of mass destruction. We have tried to communicate with Saddam through a psychic to ask him to let us see his warehouses in heaven. But he has not responded.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Of course he has not responded, because he's DEAD!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Right. Dead, and in heaven.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: This is preposterous! Even if there was a heaven, what makes you think Saddam Hussein's soul would be sent there?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Our intelligence tells us that when Saddam was originally killed, his soul actually went to hell. But while in hell he began a homosexual relationship with Satan, the Prince of Darkness. Satan, however, decided he didn't want to be with Hussein anymore and broke up with him about August.  When Saddam became jealous and tried to kill Satan's new lover, Chris, Satan had Saddam sent to heaven to live with Mormons as a punishment.  Question?  Yes?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Are you high, or just incredibly stupid?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I assure you, I am not high.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: South Park, day. A tower has gone up around the ladder at the Marsh house. Helicopters and cranes hoist. On the ground Stan and Kyle sit on some lumber watching the military take over the construction. Cartman runs up to them

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: You guys! You guys! I saw the ticket!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What do you mean, fatass?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I just had another vision, you buttholes. Kenny didn't keep the ticket with him, he put it away somewhere.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Where??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: I don't know. I got conked in the head down at the abortion clinic  and I clearly saw Kenny putting the ticket in a little red box.  I just have to wait for another vision to come. I could clearly see through Ken-  AY!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Do you see anything?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yes, Kyle. I see a DEAD JEW!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Whoawhoawhoa! Maybe Kyle's right. We gotta spark the vision somehow.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Not by giving me brain damage!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Do you want a candy shopping spree or not?!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Alright, go ahead.  AY!... no.  AY!...

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Near the back of the house. The neighbors are watchng the construction. Sharon and Sheila arrive

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Randy! Gerald! We, we were wrong about heaven! The Japanese just reached it with their ladder!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: What?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Living room, seconds later

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: See for yourself!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: the SNN Japanese correspondent is on camera

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: This is a Nobunaga Hiroichi reporting rive from hayben.  The great a-nation of Japan reached a-hayben today about eight o'crock Pacific Standard Time-eh. Therefore hayben is now a-decrared an official part of Japan, because we got a-here first. And now for the weather in heaben, let's go to Natsako Semu.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Todeh weather in hebon, partry croudy.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: That's the news from heben.  Dame! Dame da! Bakayarou da!!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Living room, seconds later

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Oh God, and we told our boys they'd never reach heaven.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kids!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Backyard. The crowd in and around the yard is immense now. George Bush and his staff are present

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Good. As soon as the boys finish their ladder we'll be ready to take Saddam out.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Do you really think this is a good idea, Randy?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: If Saddam is building weapons, we have to stop him. With our weapons.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Ah, excuse me everyone! Uh, we're not working on the ladder anymore. Thank you, we're done.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Dude.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Not working on the ladder? But the Japanese won't let us use theirs.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Kenny didn't have the ticket stub. It was in his room. So we got all our candy, and you can all go home.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Wait, are you saying that you boys only wanted to build a ladder to heaven so you could get some candy??

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: ...I've never heard the words "only" and "candy" in the same sentence before.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: But... what about yoru lost friend? What about your fragile innocence and believing we could all get to heaven?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yeah, well people make us kids believe that heaven is this white place with fluffy clouds and angels...

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yeah, but now we think maybe heaven isn't a place you can get to, maybe heaven is just an idea. A frame of mind or, or something gay like that. Maybe heaven... is this moment, right now.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: So, you're saying we should bomb this moment, right now. Right! Johnson!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Sir!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: No, no. We shouldn't bomb anybody. These boys are right. The only heaven we can hope for is one here on earth, now. We should stop waiting to get into heaven and start trying to... create it.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Awwww.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: And I was dumb enough to believe Saddam could actually be up there buildin' bombs.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Where were you when they decided heaven was a more intangible idea 'n you couldn't, you couldn't really get there?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: walks up to the boys] You little bastards ruined my latest song! [drives his guitar into the snow, breaking it, then walks away

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Well, I'm sure glad this is all over with. Let's go count our candy.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Yeah. But what about Kenny. His soul is still in Cartman's body.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: No no, I just drank his memories. I'm not sharing my body with that poor piece of crap. Stop calling me poor, you fat dick!  ...Oh Jesus Christ.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Whoa.  Kenny, you in there?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Stop it! Where am I, you guys? Oh God!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Dude, come back here!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Stop him, Kenny!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Heaven. Weapons of mass destruction are seen among the clouds. Saddam is right there shouting directions

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Keep those nitrogen capsules over there by the warheads! Right. Chop-chop. Come on!

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Saddam. I've been hearing rumors that you're secretly building weapons of mass destruction up here.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Weapons of mass destruction? Nooo! This is a chocolate chip factory. See?

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: It looks like a chemical weapons plant.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Look, God, if I was gonna secretly build a chemical weapons plant, I wouldn't make it look like a chemical weapons plant, would I? I'd make it look like a chocolate chip factory or something.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: ...Alright, just checking.

title: A LADDER TO HEAVEN
text: Stupid asshole!
